page.title: 19The E.C.C. Quarries
page.content: The E.C.C Quarries at Plymstock are situated on a private road off Billacombe roundabout. The present quarry is a combination of the two largest quarries in the Plymouth area, Moorcroft and Haye. The stone mined there is 350 million years old and is called Middle Devonian Limestone. Every week at the quarry 20-25 thousand tonnes of limestone is mined. The broken rock is taken to the crusher through which it passes twice before being screened twice. Screening is a method of grading the stone in accordance to its size. Only 10% of the finished rock is sent to other countries. The most important piece of machinery in the quarry is the conveyor belt.
